articles.title: Kim Jong Un Enjoys Art Performance of Servicepersons
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Enjoys Art Performance of Servicepersons
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, enjoyed a performance given by those who proved successful in the 36th Art Festival of KPA Servicepersons. 
					 The performers were soldiers of the companies under KPA units 251, 905, 565 and 1821 and seamen of submarine No. 730 under the navy Unit 167.
					
					 The numbers of the performance included story-telling and song "The Peerlessly Great Men of Mt. Paektu and Soldiers on Cho Islet", dialogic poem and song "We Follow You with Single Mind", interlude "'Dear Home' under Sea" and chorus "Our Destiny and Future Entrusted to You".
					
					 The performance well represented the servicepersons' happy life under the care of the supreme commander as well as their ardent yearning for him and the might of the harmonious whole of them sharing the same feelings and will with him.
					
					 The performers proudly showed their service life that they have prepared themselves to remain true to the intention of the supreme commander through more intensive military training.
					
					  At the end of the performance Kim Jong Un acknowledged the enthusiastically cheering performers.
					
					 He gave them thanks in the name of the KPA supreme commander, expressing his great satisfaction over the successful performance, clear-cut in political standard and strong in the revolutionary soldier spirit.
					
					 He noted with high appreciation that the performance was made up of numbers well showing the character and mission of the KPA as the army of the Party and its revolutionary nature and vividly and truly represented the servicepersons' efforts for strengthening their companies, a cell and a basic combat unit of the KPA.
					
					 He had a photo session with the performers, expressing conviction that they would perform greater feats in their military training and service as they displayed to the full the ideological and moral traits of the KPA in the festival.
					
					 Stressing that sustained big efforts should be directed to company art group activities to prepare the servicepersons as revolutionaries fully ready in aspects of politico-ideology and military technique and with high cultural attainments, he advanced the tasks to do so.
					
					 Among the spectators were Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Yong Gil, Jang Jong Nam, Kim Won Hong, Kim Chang Sop, Pyon In Son, So Hong Chan, Kim Su Gil, Ryom Chol Song, Kim Yong Chol, Jo Kyong Chol, Hwang Pyong So and exemplary company commanders and political instructors who participated in the 4th meeting of KPA company commanders and political instructors.

articles.title: DPRK Broadcasting Committee Delegation Returns
articles.content:
DPRK Broadcasting Committee Delegation Returns
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Central Broadcasting Committee of Korea led by its Vice-Chairman Pak Song Il returned home on Sunday after visiting China.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Keep Mum about U.S. Illegal Acts
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Keep Mum about U.S. Illegal Acts
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet authorities fell short of protesting against the U.S. illegal wiretapping.
					 After the disclosure of the fact that the U.S. National Security Agency wiretapped the south Korean embassy in Washington in June last, the puppet government of south Korea requested the U.S. to confirm whether it is true. But it has received neither confirmation nor expression of excuse so far. 
					
					 Nevertheless, the south Korean authorities have failed to utter a protesting word against the U.S. 
					
					 Even four months after the incident, the south Korean authorities have not installed security hardware to protect illegal wiretapping at the embassy. 
					
					 In this regard, the south Korean "National Assembly" is of the view that "confidence-building diplomacy" put forth by the Park Geun Hye regime is "diplomacy of a mute" and that the U.S. is the problem as it has not confirmed the case for four months and that the Foreign Ministry is the bigger problem as it has not lodged an official protest, to say nothing of ascertaining the case.

articles.title: S. Korean "Government" Denounced for Suppressing Teachers Union
articles.content:
S. Korean "Government" Denounced for Suppressing Teachers Union
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hangyore on Thursday carried an editorial titled "'Barbarous government' outlawed Teachers Union". 
					 The editorial said the "government" finally notified that it will deprive the Teachers Union of its qualification as a trade union.
					
					 It said it is anachronistic and illegal not to recognize the laid-off teachers as members of the trade union.
					
					 The behavior of the "government" drawing international criticism would be unthinkable without the self-righteousness and prejudice of Park Geun Hye, the editorial said, and went on:
					
					 She revealed strong hostility to the Teachers Union in December 2005 when she was the representative of the "Grand National Party". 
					
					 The suppression of the union is what she inherited from her father Park Chung-Hee. 
					
					 The union was established right after the April 19 incident in 1960. But the May 16 military coup forces forcefully disbanded the teachers trade union for the reason that it was critical of the "government", and laid off 1,500 teachers branding them as "pro-communists".
					
					 It is impossible to disorganize the Teacher Union although it was outlawed.
					
					 The "government" should know that it will face strong protest of all the people if it does not retract the unjust notification.

articles.title: Woman Officer Commits Suicide in S. Korea
articles.content:
Woman Officer Commits Suicide in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- A woman officer of the puppet army of south Korea on Oct. 16 committed suicide after leaving a testament indicting her superior for sexually assaulting her several times, according to MBC of south Korea. 
					 The number of suicides is on the increase in the puppet army for reasons of beating, violence and sexual assault.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime's Fraud-tainted "Election" under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime's Fraud-tainted "Election" under Fire
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- It has been recently disclosed in south Korea that the puppet military was involved in building up the public opinion during the "presidential election" last year.
					 The agents of the Cyber Command of the south Korean army slandered the candidates from opposition parties and posted on websites articles praising the present chief executive and the "Saenuri Party" as part of their smear election campaign.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 Such an act was actively supported by the Intelligence Service (IS) as evidenced by the fact that the command received 4.5 billion won from the IS last year.
					
					 This brought to light the truth about the conspiracy and organized crimes of the group of the "Saenuri Party", the IS, military and other fascist dictatorial forces which aimed to maintain the conservative regime.
					
					 South Koreans' resentment is mounting sky-high against the puppet ruling quarters which conducted the "presidential election" in an illegal and fraudulent manner to keep the conservative regime in power and revive the "yusin" dictatorship.
					
					 It is quite natural for the different circles of south Korea to strongly demand the disbandment of plot-breeding organs which work with blood-shot eyes to violate democracy and establish dictatorial system as a cat's paw of the ruling forces, an apology from the present chief executive and "nullification of her election as president."

articles.title: Candlelight Action in S. Korea Denounces Crackdown on Teachers Union
articles.content:
Candlelight Action in S. Korea Denounces Crackdown on Teachers Union
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Teachers Union held a candlelight rally before the building of the puppet Ministry of Education on Oct. 24 in protest against the regime's fascist suppression.
					 At the rally speakers accused the regime of taking a measure outlawing the union that day, strongly denouncing the authorities for not lending an ear to the voice of the people.
					
					 Park Geun Hye informed the union that it is not a trade union, they noted, stressing that they will then inform Park that she is not "president."
					
					 To exclude from the union those who were unreasonably fired after working for proper education is an act aimed at weakening the fighting capability of the union, they deplored.
					
					 The present regime which emerged in an illegal way by setting in motion the Intelligence Service and Defense Ministry is the "government out of law", they held.

articles.title: China and Japan Report News of Kim Jong Un's Guidance of KPA Meeting
articles.content:
China and Japan Report News of Kim Jong Un's Guidance of KPA Meeting
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- News agencies, papers and broadcasting services of China and Japan on Friday reported the news that Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Un guided the 4th meeting of company commanders and political instructors of the KPA. 
					 The Chinese News Service said:
					
					 The 4th meeting of company commanders and political instructors of the KPA took place in Pyongyang on October 22 and 23.
					
					 The supreme leader of the DPRK Kim Jong Un guided the meeting.
					
					 He made an opening speech at the meeting.
					
					 He heard with keen interest all the speeches made by company commanders and political instructors throughout the meeting. He invited the commander and former political instructor of the Kamnamu (persimmon tree) company there to have a photo taken with them.
					
					 He made a historic speech at the meeting.
					
					 He awarded the title of Labor Hero, gold medal (hammer and sickle) and Order of National Flag First Class to the company commanders and political instructors who performed distinguished feats.
					
					 He made the closing address at the meeting. 
					
					 He declared the meeting closed, expressing the belief that all participants in the meeting would augment the might of the People's Army in every way, united close around the Workers' Party of Korea, and thus perform their duty in carrying out the revolutionary cause of Songun.
					
					 The Chinese newspaper Global Times, Chinese Central TV, Phoenix Satellite TV, Hong Kong, China and the Japanese newspaper Mainichi Shimbun reported the same news. 
					
					 The Chinese Central TV telecasted a photo of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Program "2013 Travelogue on DPRK" Aired by TV of Hong Kong, China
articles.content:
Program "2013 Travelogue on DPRK" Aired by TV of Hong Kong, China
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- Phoenix Satellite TV, Hong Kong, China aired program "2013 Travelogue on DPRK" on Oct. 20. 
					 It conveyed accounts of the grand opening ceremony of the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum successfully built as a grand monumental edifice in the Songun era under the wise guidance of Marshal Kim Jong Un held on July 27. 
					
					 It introduced in detail the fact that the capital city of Pyongyang with a long history has been splendidly face-lifted as a modern one and President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il made sure that Tangun, who had been regarded as a mythical being, was ascertained as the ancestral father of the Korean nation and that the Mausoleum of King Tangun was successfully rebuilt. 
					
					 It also aired scenes of the joint friendship gathering of war veterans of the DPRK and China held in Pyongyang to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.

articles.title: Important Anniversaries of WPK Marked in Colombia, Brazil
articles.content:
Important Anniversaries of WPK Marked in Colombia, Brazil
 Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- Seminars were held by the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea "Kanggye" of Colombia and the Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea on Oct. 17 to mark the 68th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the 87th anniversary of the formation of the Down-with-Imperialism Union (DIU). 
					 Jairo Gonzalez Trujillo, president of the Colombian group, said that President Kim Il Sung laid the organizational and ideological foundation for building a revolutionary party in the crucible of the anti-Japanese war and founded the WPK after the liberation of Korea and wisely led it to fulfill its role as the general staff of the revolution. 
					
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il developed the WPK into the invincible revolutionary party and firmly defended socialism, he said, adding that it has brought about unprecedented leap forward and innovations in the building of a thriving nation under the Songun leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Aleksandr Neves Rosendo da Silva, chairman of the Brazilian center, said: 
					
					 The formation of the DIU by Kim Il Sung on Oct. 17, 1926 was a historic declaration heralding the start of the Korean revolution. 
					
					 This also marked a landmark event which brought about a fundamental turning point in carving out the destiny of the Korean people. 
					
					 The Korean revolution which started from the DIU is now dynamically advancing along the road of independence, Songun and socialism under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Victory and glory are always in store for the WPK carrying forward the history and tradition of the DIU.
